content:
```text
HyperCode Code of Conduct

We are committed to providing a welcoming and respectful community for all contributors, especially those with lived experience of neurodivergence or disability.

Our standards
- Be respectful in language, tone, and engagement.
- Assume good intent and give people space to learn and improve.
- Use inclusive language and avoid ableist or demeaning terminology.
- Respect boundaries around communication styles and response time.

Unacceptable behavior
- Harassment, abuse, hateful or demeaning comments.
- Deliberate misgendering, outting, or exposing private information.
- Dismissing or belittling accessibility, neurodiversity, or accommodation requests.

Reporting & enforcement
- If you experience or witness policy violations, please contact: [repo-maintainers-email-or-GitHub-issue-link]
- Reports will be handled confidentially and promptly by the maintainers.
- Consequences may include warnings, removal from the community, or reporting to GitHub for severe violations.

Commitment
We aim to maintain a community where diverse thinking is valued and where people can contribute without masking or fear. If you need reasonable accommodations for contributing (longer review windows, alternate feedback formats, etc.), please indicate that in your PR or contact a maintainer.

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant (v2.x) and tailored to emphasize inclusion for neurodivergent contributors.

Effective date: 2025-11-19
```
